page.title: 13CIMLA FIRE STATION
page.content: The station was built in 1962 and became operational in April 1963.It replaced the previous fire station in Neath.The present Area Divisional Fire Officer is Mr. Hocking.There are 49 full time and 15 part time firemen.The men work in shifts called "watches". There are 12 men to a watch,a station officer,sub officer,leading fireman and 9 firemen.There are 4 colour coded watches,Red,Green,Blue and White.There are 5 appliances,2 water tenders,both hold 1680 litres,one Simon Snorkel which reaches a height of 20 metres, an emergency tender,foam tender and a Land Rover tender. The station serves an area of 100 square kilometres.They attend approx. 800 fires annually.Most are seasonal with grass,moorland, forest and mountain fires in summer.In winter house fires are frequent.They also attend road accidents.
